content: I'd like to search for any users by the email domain in their registered user account. I can see that information, so I should be able to search by it>
@Grahame Grieve Are you talking about from the buddy list?
from the user list on the right. I can search by name. But not, so far as I can tell, by domain in the id

from the user list on the right. I can search by name. But not, so far as I can tell, by domain in the id

Confirmed. The user search does look at emails, but it only calls it a match if your search term matches the first letters of the whole email.

I think the only way to do this in a fairly straightforward way is to check for "@" at the start of the search string, and that would be our clue that you're searching for domains. (I'm wary of always looking for domain matches, because that can be super noisy.)
of course it's utility would be limited, since mostly users will be @gmail etc
but it does have some utility for some communities, i think

but it does have some utility for some communities, i think

I agree. Feel free to open an issue. @Rishi Gupta do you see any pitfalls in having searches like "@gmail" trying to match domain names? (It should be fine performance-wise, and I can't think of any usability issues. I don't mind if requiring "@" a bit inconvenient or hard to discover; my bigger concern is breaking behavior for normal searches.)

The current user typeahead match function is a bit crazy, which makes it a bit hard to think about (product wise; I expect this isn't a hard change technically).
Ideally I'd like to move the stream and user typeahead to just be substring based, which will make domain matching more noisy.

I could eventually imagine adding search keywords like email:foo or profile:foo (for searching custom profile fields) though.
Is this a valid issue and is anyone working on it? I am a student at the University of Michigan looking to contribute to an open source project for my upper-level software engineering class.
@Julian Galperin Yes, it's valid, and you can claim the issue by saying '@zulipbot claim'.

I would stick to issues with help wanted or good first issue.
The reason this issue doesn't have those labels is because we haven't decided on what the solution should be -- there are a number of possibilities, and work on the feature will get stuck in product review.
https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/overview/contributing.html has our contributing guide, and is a helpful read
